GlooKit.GlooAPI

Class Worker

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooAPI.Worker

  • public class Worker
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean halt
      A flag used to permanently halt all the Worker threads associated with this thread.
      private boolean idle
      A flag used to check whether a thread currently has any available work.
      private java.util.Queue<java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<java.lang.Object>> queue
      A reference to the queue utilized by this Worker pool / thread
      private Worker[] workers
      A reference to a collection of all the Worker threads associated with this one.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
        Worker()
      A public default constructor which creates a worker pool with a number of threads appropriate for the runtime environment.

      A public constructor which creates a worker pool with a set number of threads.
      private Worker(java.util.Queue<java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<java.lang.Object>> queue, Worker[] workers)
      A private constructor used in order to create worker pools.

    • Field Detail

      • halt

        private boolean halt
        A flag used to permanently halt all the Worker threads associated with this thread.

      • idle

        private boolean idle
        A flag used to check whether a thread currently has any available work.

      • workers

        private final Worker[] workers
        A reference to a collection of all the Worker threads associated with this one.

      • queue

        private final java.util.Queue<java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<java.lang.Object>> queue
        A reference to the queue utilized by this Worker pool / thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • Worker

        public Worker()
        A public default constructor which creates a worker pool with a number of threads appropriate for the runtime environment.

      • Worker

        public Worker(int count)
        A public constructor which creates a worker pool with a set number of threads.
        Parameters:
        count - indicates the number of threads the worker pool will possess.

      • Worker

        private Worker(java.util.Queue<java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<java.lang.Object>> queue,
               Worker[] workers)
        A private constructor used in order to create worker pools. Worker pools all reference the same queue and worker list, necessitating this constructor. All Workers created with this constructor may not be referenced outside of this file.
        Parameters:
        queue - represents the queue utilized by this hidden worker.
        workers - represents a collection of all Workers utilizing the same queue as this one.

    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        private java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<java.lang.Object> enqueue(java.lang.Runnable task)
        A private call which securely queues Runnable tasks into this Worker's operating queue.
        Parameters:
        task - is a Runnable, which will be taken up by one of the Worker threads associated with this Worker's queue.
        Returns:
        Returns the FutureTask of the task submitted to the queue. This information is important to capture so that tasks can later be waited upon and/or confirmed to have been executed.

      • dequeue

        private java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<java.lang.Object> dequeue()
        Safely removes a task from the queue, so that this thread may execute that task.
        Returns:
        Returns the FutureTask of the retrieved task. This information is important to capture so that tasks can later be waited upon and/or confirmed to have been executed.

      • task

        public java.util.concurrent.Future[] task(java.lang.Runnable[] tasks)
        One of the primary utility functions of a Worker pool, this method handles the enqueuing of tasks and returns the futures necessary for managing those tasks over time.
        Parameters:
        tasks - is a collection of tasks to be enqueued.
        Returns:
        The FutureTask representations of the given tasks (in order to handle asynchronisity, probably through the use of the await methods).

      • task

        public java.util.concurrent.Future task(java.lang.Runnable task)
        One of the primary utility functions of a Worker pool, this method handles the enqueuing of tasks and returns the futures necessary for managing those tasks over time.
        Parameters:
        task - is a single task to be enqueued.
        Returns:
        The FutureTask representations of the given task (in order to handle asynchronisity, probably through the use of the await methods).

      • await

        public void await(java.util.concurrent.Future future)
        One of the primary utility functions of a Worker pool, this method blocks the thread it is called in until the completion of the given future tasks. While waiting, the thread is in a true wait and yields its cpu time to other tasks.
        Parameters:
        future - is the task to be awaited.

      • await

        public void await(java.util.concurrent.Future[] futures)
        One of the primary utility functions of a Worker pool, this method blocks the thread it is called in until the completion of the given future tasks. While waiting, the thread is in a true wait and yields its cpu time to other tasks.
        Parameters:
        futures - is the group of tasks to be awaited.

      • size

        public int size()

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
